sessions.title: Panel discussion: Technology and the Future of Work
sessions.description: Technology and the Future of Work

sessions.title: Embracing a new era of automation, tools, and platforms at MCB
sessions.description:
In today’s highly competitive and fast-paced business environment, it is becoming crucial for organizations to accelerate their digital agenda by embracing fast-moving technology trends to keep up with technological change. 

At MCB, digital transformation is central to its growth strategy and operating model. To enable new business models and improve operational efficiency, MCB has updated its core infrastructure, adopted new technologies, automation tools, and platforms, and reassessed its digital priorities as part of its new accelerated digital transformation strategy. 

This approach has contributed to more significant business outcomes by unlocking the potential of an organization to enhance the customer experience across channels.

sessions.title: Go: from scratch to prod
sessions.description:
Crash course to get acquainted with Golang development.
Together we will build, test and deploy a web application using Golang.

sessions.title: Symfony - Workshop
sessions.description:
Come discover the Symfony framework during a 4h hands-on workshop. We will learn the basics of Symfony, how to build a form and submit data to a doctrine entity.  

Please bring your own laptop to this interactive session. It should have a working development environment with PHP8 ( Xampp or Docker)

Agenda :
11h - Introduction to Symfony6
11h30 - Installation
12h - Controller, Routing, Templating with Twig
13h - Pause 15mins
13h20 - Form, Validation
14h - Entity, Repository, Doctrine
14h45 - Wrap up

sessions.title: SWAN - The Digital Journey
sessions.description: Swan has always been in the forefront to shape the insurance landscape in Mauritius. It has been the pioneer of various initiatives and innovations brought to this industry. More than ever, Swan has embarked in some major digitalisation projects across all business areas with an emphasis on efficiency and  ultimately enhancing customer experience.

sessions.title: Add more security with Azure Keyvault.
sessions.description:
Our codes need to talk to external services to get information. Whether it's from external providers or other teams, we get these information using APIs.
As sensitive information is sent, we need to secure the call. To do so, we need to make sure that the password needed to make a successful call is hidden to unauthorised person. Azure Key vault allows you to do that and much more. Join me during this session to learn more about it and how to set it up.

sessions.title: Building reliable web services with Kotlin Ktor
sessions.description:
Through this session, you will learn how to setup a Kotlin Ktor project with some routes using the framework tools and features (Routing, DataConversion, ContentNegotiation...) and communicate with a sample Android app.

Let see how we can easily setup a Postgres database connection with Exposed, an ORM library for Kotlin and see how clean architecture can be a good choice for developping your brand new API.

We can even go further and see that we can actully share code from your backend application and your Android application (say hi to Swagger!).

sessions.title: Beyond the web of today
sessions.description:
At Intel we work on the forefront of innovation as our hardware roadmaps are defined years ahead of release. This means that we need to make sure that the web platform takes advantage of new hardware capabilities as they are released or shortly after. This ranges from enabling new form factors to taking advantage of hardware accelerators.

In this talk we will discuss some of the new innovations that Intel is bringing to the web, such as WebNN, which enables access to fast neural network and machine learning capabilities; foldable device support and Compute Pressure, a new API enabling better user experience and bringing adaptive compute capabilities to the client, just like adaptive streaming has improved streaming use-cases by adapting to live network conditions.

sessions.title: Debugging techniques for uncertain times
sessions.description: In this session, we will explain what debugging is and examine tools and strategies to debug a React application The three main tools we shall look at are print logging, the browser Dev tools and the visual studio code IDE debugger.

sessions.title: How Artificial Intelligence is being used in NLP
sessions.description:
When you take AI and focus it on human linguistics, you get NLP. “NLP makes it possible for humans to talk to machines:” This branch of AI enables computers to understand, interpret, and manipulate human language.

We are going to present about how AI is being used in NLP and the different tools with which it can be accomplished along with some case studies

sessions.title: A journey into open source
sessions.description: A talk around at the inner workings of open source not only as a way to distribute free and open software code but now increasingly as a business model for many companies and individuals around the world. The open source landscape has greatly evolved over years and this talk will have a look at the sometimes lesser talked aspects like the economics and various dynamics at play, and how you can be a part of it.

sessions.title: Maintaining quality in the new normal
sessions.description:
- Importance of testing
- Quality is NOT just the responsibility of Test Engineers
- Importance of early testing - F & NF
- Keeping the remote testing team motivated (cut down on meeting)
- Develop a team of curious and inquisitive individuals (how to leverage on individual Strengths)
- Enforcing the different ceremonies of SDLC

sessions.title: Blockchain in a Nutshell
sessions.description:
The future will be increasingly distributed. As the publicity surrounding Bitcoin and blockchain has shown, distributed technology and business models are gaining popularity. Yet the disruptive potential of this technology is often obscured by hype and misconception.

This session will be exciting as it will cover the buzz around blockchain. 

We will:
-  Understand why Bitcoin was fundamentally important in blockchain's birth.

- See how Ethereum has created a prolific ground for innovations like Decentralized Finance (DeFi), Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) and Flash Loans.

- Uncover the secrets behind cryptocurrency prices and different forces that affect the highly volatile cryptocurrency markets.

- Peek into how cryptocurrencies are used by criminals to carry out nefarious activities.

- Then we'll come across how enterprise and governments are leveraging the blockchain including social media.

- Understand the challenges of scaling and forking a blockchain

- Briefly learn how different blockchains work

- Discover the language of blockchain as industry terms are explained.

sessions.title: How to serve billions of images, without billions of dollars.
sessions.description:
Having built multiple platforms which are heavy on Image content, we’ve continuously optimised our internal solution for scale, performance and cost. This year alone, we’ve served over two billion Images through this solution, all without breaking the bank!  

I’ll share our approach for our internal Image micro-service, and give you all the information you need to architect your own solution.

sessions.title: How I ended up needing to fix a bug in the ZFS file system
sessions.description:
In this talk, I'll walk you through my adventure of finding and fixing a bug in OpenZFS that was affecting EventStoreDB's cloud customers.

It all starts with someone noticing that, approximately once a week, a write to the database would take around 15 seconds ...

The talk will guide you through the tools you can use to debug the linux kernel.

sessions.title: Right to Repair Much?
sessions.description: The US passed the 'Right to Repair' bill to spur competition within the technology market. What is Mauritius stance on technological equipment maintenance & repairs?

sessions.title: Running SQL Server on GCP
sessions.description:
When talking about Cloud SQL instances on the Google Cloud Platform usually it relates to flexible and convenient handling of MySQL. Eventually, and probably less common, someone might actually speak about PostgreSQL. However in recent times Google added a third option to the Cloud SQL service: Microsoft SQL Server.

Cloud SQL is a fully managed relational database service and is fully compatible with applications using MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server. You can connect with nearly any application, anywhere in the world. Cloud SQL automates backups, replication, and fail-over to ensure your database is reliable, highly available, and flexible to your performance needs.

The described feature-set of SQL Server on GCP lists everything needed for secure, high-available, high performance, and scalable solutions. Cloud SQL instances can be easily reached from other GCP services, including App Engine, Compute Engine, Kubernetes Engine, as well as your workstation. BigQuery is capable to query directly an existing Cloud SQL database.

sessions.title: Digital transformation: Bridging the Gap between strategy and execution
sessions.description: This session gives an insight on how to manage digital transformation, the pitfalls and highlights how to be successful. Strategy and execution are often disconnected. It provides participants with guidance on how to bridge the gap between strategy and execution.

sessions.title: Understanding the underlying stack of Linux containers - in just 5 mins
sessions.description:
Ever wondered about the magic behind containers in 5 mins?
By the end of this presentation, you will understand how Linux containers operate using low-level utilities that interact directly with the Kernel namespaces.

With your 5-mins knowledge, you will then be able to master how real-world Container Technologies are working — there is no magic. With a live demo on creating new subsystem hierarchies with individual Control Groups and Namespaces and ending on a sweet network bridge between two different namespaces.

sessions.title: How to certify your hardware project or product by OSHWA (Open Source Hardware Association)
sessions.description: In this session, I'll be talking about what open hardware is, why should we care, and how to certify a hardware project/product by OSHWA (Open Source Hardware Association) for free.

sessions.title: Develop .NET apps for GCP
sessions.description:
Microsoft is opening up towards more Open Source Software (OSS), with the availability of .NET on Windows, macOS and Linux. Having Microsoft as a premium partner in the Linux foundation, there are great opportunities to extend your programming skills and business solutions to other platforms than Windows. Using .NET  on Linux is just the beginning of cross-platform development in C#. Explore now and be ready!

The session evaluates the possibilities to set up your development environment on Linux Visual Studio Code, develop an .NET application or service from scratch, and explains the different options to deploy and operate it on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

sessions.title: A Brief History of Programming
sessions.description: The first high level programming language, FORTRAN, was created in 1957. This session explores some of my favourite programming languages and programming paradigms which have emerged during the last 2^6 years.

sessions.title: Javascript: A look behind the scenes
sessions.description:
A deep dive into the mechanics of javascript
        ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

sessions.title: Microsoft genomics
sessions.description: Explore the field of genomics that help scientists to identify the genome of a virus and other bacterial to acquire vaccine and medicine to fight, With this session, you will dive into a new service that Microsoft offers which is called Microsoft Genomics and offers to analyze genetic sequence file using high powered computing on the cloud.

sessions.title: ESP8266 a practical approach
sessions.description:
Understanding what modern micro controllers can achieve 
1)  The anatomy of of the micro controller
2)  Processor
3) GPIO
4) I2C
5) SPI
6) Analog input  ADC

Practical Session 
Making a simple display sign using  an ESP 8266 and some LED matrix display that will be programable via a web interface.

sessions.title: Enhancing the quality of working life
sessions.description: The session will focus on the initiatives that are being taken to constantly improve employee well-being and work-life integration through leadership, the adoption of best practices and technology at SWAN.

sessions.title: Build Applications Fast, Right, and for the Future with Outsystems
sessions.description:
The OutSystems platform is designed to dramatically accelerate the development process for your essential applications while also delivering unprecedented levels of flexibility, enabling developers to continuously evolve applications as business needs and technology trends evolve.

Join in this session to see the speed of development of simple web pages within seconds and some complete webpages developed within minutes.

Also included: Integrate your existing data and email integration.

At the end of the day, development should be less of a concern. Just think of optimising your business processes.

sessions.title: Camunda - The Universal Process Orchestrator
sessions.description:
Main idea: How to setup Camunda BPM and orchestrate processes.
Subtopics:
1. Introduction to Camunda BPM
2. BPMN and DMN
4. Architecture (Standalone vs Embedded, Database, Container platform, etc.)
5. Micro services (Service Choreography vs Service Orchestration)
6. Setup Camunda BPM in Spring Boot
7. Orchestrate Processes

What will attendees discover by attending your session in 3-5 full sentences?
1. Attendees will learn about Camunda BPM and it’s benefits.
2. It is a lightweight tool which can be easily embedded in a Spring Boot project as a dependency
3. Use of rest API
4. Understand the micro services architecture that can be implemented

sessions.title: Putting AI into action in Manufacturing
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has been in the limelight over the past few years because the pervasive nature of this technology makes it attractive to many industries. As a leading apparel manufacturer, we are applying the various possibilities of AI in our production systems. Throughout our thrilling journey of digital transformation, our passionate technologists tested the opportunities and limits of AI in our quest for enhanced productivity. We applied AI to unchartered waters through successful POCs but we also accumulated learnings not found in academic literature. Join us to learn how AI will transform the industry in Mauritius!

sessions.title: Introduction to RFC 7807 in Golang. A Better REST HTTP API Error Responses.
sessions.description:
Join me for a live demo to demonstrate better handling of REST HTTP API error responses by implementing the RFC 7807 standard in Golang.

RFC 7807 provides a standard format for returning problem details from HTTP APIs.  It defines a "problem detail" as a way to carry machine-readable details of errors in a HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error response formats for HTTP APIs. Problem details will be addressed in depth in the presentation as well as how to tackle those details with the standard.

sessions.title: An introduction to TailwindCSS
sessions.description:
Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework packed with classes that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup. In other words, another cooler way to write CSS.

Agenda:
- Getting started with Tailwind CSS
- Core concepts that make Tailwind CSS different from writing traditional CSS.
- Demo time - Develop a simple card using TailwindCSS
- why use TailwindCss?
- What’s new in Tailwind v3.1

sessions.title: Printed Circuit Board design and manufacturing
sessions.description: So in this session I will be explaining how you can implement your electronics project or some piece of art or create cool stuff with a printed circuit board. I will then explain how these boards are designed , the different kinds that exist ,what you need to know if you ever want to design one and give some tips. Additionally I will show how these printed circuit boards are made, how you can get one made and save some money when doing so.

sessions.title: Become a Blockchain Developer
sessions.description:
Demand for blockchain developers worldwide is skyrocketing. 
Should you pay attention to this emerging area ... maybe ? 

I'll introduce what blockchains are and what developers can ambition to become in that booming space.

sessions.title: Infrastructure logging with the Elastic Stack
sessions.description:
Introduction and basic explanation of roles of each technology in the ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana and the Beats).

Understand why centralized logging is important and how the ELK Stack helps solve that issue.

Finally, we will end with a demo, demonstrating the ELK Stack in action.

sessions.title: The Mathematics of Performance Testing
sessions.description: The talk will be centered on how to get the best of performance testing on a software product. It will be covering the types of performance tests, the client journey, and how random number generator plugs in the performance test framework. I will also shed light on how by applying some mathematical concepts we can analyse and propose recommendations for optimisation and fixes on a software

sessions.title: My First Baby Steps with: Git
sessions.description:
Introduce students to Version Control and Collaboration tools world.

- Installation on command line
- Creating your first commit
- How branching work
- Demonstration with a simple HTML website
- Pushing to GitHub
- Bonus: Git hooks!

sessions.title: La gestion d'état réactive sur Angular avec NgRx
sessions.description: La gestion des données peut devenir complexe lorsqu'une application évolue, rendant la maintenance difficile. La librairie NgRx permet de résoudre ce problème dans une application sous Angular, avec son système de "state management", favorisant un flux de données unidirectionnel, qui facilitera la prédictibilité des données manipulées dans l'application.

sessions.title: Data Analytics
sessions.description:
Main idea:
Data Analytics - why is it important?

Topics:
what is data analytics
types of data analytics
the process and tools (that is steps involved in data analytics and data analytics tools)
ways to use data analytics (its application)
case study 
live demo 

What will attendees discover by attending your session?
Attendees will have a brief overview of what is data analytics and the different components.
How we already use the information obtained through data analytics in our daily routines unknowingly
How we can use Data Analytics in our Companies to attain goals more easily
The next steps after Analysing data (Decision making and later Prediction)

sessions.title: Microservices Architecture
sessions.description: Microservices are an architectural approach to decompose complex applications into smaller and independent services. In this session, we’ll discuss the benefits of moving from monolithic to micro-services application architectures.

sessions.title: IoT and social media integration with Node-RED
sessions.description:
We shall explore how we can use Node-RED to create powerful IoT integrated systems.

Can you make a light turn on whenever a client contacts you on your Facebook page?  Can you open your door with a twitter tweet? Can you create a crawl bot so that you get alerted whenever a product is on promotion, or your favorite stock or currency rates are changing? 

Let's discover the various kinds of integrating the physical world with virtual world with Node-RED.

sessions.title: Boosting your web traffic in 2022
sessions.description: Google's Helpful Content Update in late 2022 now ranks websites using more sophisticated criteria and penalises certain websites. In this session we look at the most important ranking factors, how to implement them and how to avoid getting penalised.

sessions.title: Angular Compiler in depth
sessions.description:
We will discuss and review the compiler mechanism and how it evolved until Angular Ivy.
The pros & cons of the compiler.
Note that this is a very technical presentation and knowledge about angular is needed to fully understand the concept

sessions.title: Build and ship faster
sessions.description:
Are your teams being challenged to build software faster? This seems to be an eternal request for many software engineering teams! But wait, what are the signs that the teams are 'slow' in the first place?

In this session, we shall the different strategies to help teams scale up their operations, in terms of people, teams, applications, and infrastructure with several real-life case studies, problems, and solutions.

The session covers several aspects of the software development life cycle including coding practices, DevOps, security, and coaching. We'll also discuss some non-tech matters which slowing the teams and discuss potential alternatives.

sessions.title: Modern Front-end Development with ViteJS
sessions.description:
ViteJS is very new, but has quickly become the default front-end development tooling backbone during the past year. 

It was originally made for Vue, but it now works for React, Svelte, Solid and others. 

Why Vite? It's fast, it's really, REALLY fast. 

In this session I'll give a demo of how Vite can improve your Developer Experience and why it's becoming the de-facto dev-tool-of-choice over the mighty webpack !

sessions.title: The Politics & Fallacies in Agile
sessions.description:
For years, Agile has been sold as a solution that will solve all problems in your company from workflows, project management problems to fixing the kitchen sink; it is, however, plagued with flaws that many Agile practitioners are unaware of. Companies and team members have been indoctrinated to use Agile, but they haven't been taught the proper essence of the concept or how beautiful it is. Agile has been modified to fit company cultures and practices to the extent that IT companies enforce their own structures over the «true» Agile principles.

Basically, the main goal of Agile is to ship software incrementally while favoring high collaboration between stakeholders and no hierarchy is present between team members. However many companies around the world tend to practice overwise. We will be unraveling the politics and fallacies deeply hidden in corporations that continue to operate in the same old hierarchical-political-bossy-micromanaged way, sometimes even worse, but under the guise of Agile.

Main topics covered throughout this session:

1. Vendor/Technology lock-in 
2. Project Management vs Agile 
3. Agile in office vs Open Source Project Management 
4. Goodwill «in Open Source» vs «in office» 
5. Silly Job Titles in Agile 
6. Micro-management in disguise 
7. Things that don’t have anything to do with Agile 
    1. Version Control 
    2. DevOps 
    3. Software good practices 
    4. Containers 
8. The billion-dollar business of Certifications 
9. The Scrum Master who does not have a clue of technology or business  
10. The Agile poison 
11. Company Cultures 
12. Vested interests by third parties - Coach, Companies selling Agile-centric software 
13. The amount of energy and time invested into meetings 
14. Blame game is hidden, but it never goes away 
15. Fullstack is a cost control strategy, not empowering developers 
16. Open space office - To save cost and not for «openness» 
17. Agile «evangelist» come at companies to sell «children games», and some «advices» at high prices 
18. The psychology advice given by unlearned people in the field 
19. Too many tellers gets the «good money and good life», but the actual «doers» not so much 
20. Agile culture/philosophy is lost in translation and implementation 
21. People who get training camp for a few weeks and are expected to do miracles afterward like «Rockstar» developers.

sessions.title: The Full Stack Journey, A Rich and Fulfilling, But Challenging Path!
sessions.description:
[Your full stack journey awaits for you] This buzz word is what 97% of head hunters are looking for on your LinkedIn profile. Angular And .NET is one path and my path. With that I want to open the conversation about the challenges I faced and how to get through them.

Know that this talk could make you more employable to the market, if you are struggling to find a path in the full stack arena.

sessions.title: Remote code execution - how security exploits work
sessions.description: In this talk we'll explore hands-on examples of how your computer can get compromised due to poorly written, insecure, code. The talk will focus mainly on binary exploitation and on the fundamental, low-level, details of how exploits such as buffer overflows, etc. work.

sessions.title: Hadoop For Noobs
sessions.description: Get a quick overview of the Hadoop ecosystem and how it can be used for distributed computing and big data by coupling it with Apache Spark. The session will then be followed by a small introduction on Apache Spark and then closed by a hands on demo of Apache Spark jobs running on Hadoop using PySpark.

sessions.title: Your Happiness & Wellbeing Matters.
sessions.description:
The IT industry is one of the most stressful to work in. It is essential for IT passionate to focus on their own happiness and wellbeing on a day to day basis to ensure productivity. 

The IT industry can also be quite competitive where learning is really a never ending process and makes the whole difference,

Employers also have an important role to play in providing a secure, safe and nurturing environment for their staff to evolve but ultimately employees are the ones responsible to balance things out.

IT professionals constantly need to be up to date, with long hours behind the screens or long sleepless nights with their best friend by their sides : A cup of black coffee.

Ensure work-life balance is a MUST in one of the fastest moving industry.

This session will be focused on :
1) The backdrop of IT industry- Stress & Long hours
2)  Best practice to maintain a work-life balance

sessions.title: Building Production-Ready Swarm Clusters on Docker-CE
sessions.description:
This talk aims to present Docker Swarm as a viable production container orchestration solution.
The ideal target audience member is a developer within a small team or a startup which is considering options for streamlining their local development and deployment.

The basis of the talk is that, when using Docker Community Edition, one needs quite a bit of additional tooling - in the form of a tech stack - to meet the stern demands of production environments. Some requirements of orchestration systems in such environments (ease of deployment, ease of app provisioning, security, authentication) will be acknowledged, and open-source tools will be showcased being employed to address these concerns.

The talk will showcase how Docker Swarm may enable us to tap into a wealth of open-source solutions to build an expansive and easily extensible development environment, and how, relying on the isomorphism of containers, this environement may be ported to production. 


Amongst the technologies showcased will be:
- Traefik Proxy (https://traefik.io/traefik/ : for which I am an ambassador)
- Portainer, GUI cluster management tool which lowers the barrier of entry to orchestration for non-ops-oriented developers
- Keycloak, an open-source Identity and Access Management Solution which I used extensively, and developed extension modules for.

Note that this talk will expand on this Hacktoberfest talk I did a year ago: https://slides.com/occupytheweb/deck-b2464a  (the slides were made in a rush, and the presentation was more demo-oriented)

sessions.title: Securing and managing your own mail server
sessions.description:
We will install and configure a mail server on Ubuntu and openSUSE as part of a demo. We will explore the config needed to setup mail redirection, mailing lists and understand the role of SPF, DKIM and DMARC in email security.

By the end of the presentation attendees should be able to setup their own mail server. I would recommend that attendees who already own a domain and would like to setup a mail service may bring their laptop and repeat the steps during the presentation. 

We can also continue troubleshooting mail problems during the coffee breaks.

sessions.title: 3D Websites: Three.JS
sessions.description:
Let's dive into Three.js - a lightweight web-ready library equipped with all the bells and whistles you need to embark on an easy 3D development journey!

Description
The session will dive into the basics of what is involved when creating 3D elements using web technologies (html/css/js).
- Scene
- Shapes
- Materials
- Lighting
- Effects
- Interactivity

Audience:
Session is targeted for web-savvy beginners, with an interest in creating websites with cool effects and 3D magic. Expect a lot of live coding (and a few crashes!) with very few slides ;)

Product of session:
+ Basic web page with an interactive 3D element

Objectives of session:
+ Introduce Three.JS
+ Understand the basics of 3D graphics/rendering
+ Live coding a website with 3D
+ Peek at what websites could be with 3D

Agenda:
+ Showcase: Websites with 3D effects/elements
+ The process behind creating 3D elements in general
+ Introduction to Three.JS
+ Create a basic sphere using Three.JS
+ Create an interactive terrain using Three.JS
+ Rapid fire: What else could be done using this technology

sessions.title: Types to the rescue
sessions.description: Types is often underrated in programming, in this session you will learn what a good type system looks like, and can it help to have less bugs. We will be discussing about nullable types, refine types, structural types,literal types,union, intersection types and so forth.

sessions.title: Stacks for Web Applications
sessions.description:
A "tech stack" includes all the technologies used to build a complete web or mobile application (frameworks, cloud services, libraries, languages, and APIs ... )

In this session, we'll

- Choose a Tech Stack for Web Development
- Compare JS frameworks
- Highlight React State Management with Redux
- Ship Containers with Docker and Kubernetes
- Add mobile dev with React Native, Flutter, & Ionic
- Glue everything with APIs [GraphQL and Apollo]
- And won't forget about Cloud Computing

sessions.title: Fast Flask Dev With Big Codebases
sessions.description:
Flask is lightweight, up-to-the point and customisable. It gives you the joy of coding back. You can take the time and chisel your perfect web development setup. You don't have to learn and follow the whims of framework maintainers as much as you would with other frameworks. Coupled with the relative stability of it's plugins ecosystem and mature related-technologies, Flask still spells out the perfect solution for many.

However, you can wait for some years before you tune many parameters that allow you to ship projects quickly. You need to become a master at many aspects before you get the needed insights to pin down improvements that prove to be real wins. This session compiles tips and lessons from using and teaching Flask over the years. It combines techniques learnt from Flask projects and concepts never ever seen before in the Flask world.

It's a world-grade Flask session with proofs of work

sessions.title: Artificial Intelligence : Benefits & Risks
sessions.description:
Since the birth of AI in 1956, the term “artificial intelligence”, probably first coined to create a striking impact, has continued to expand drastically , and the technologies it has catalyzed have contributed greatly to changing the world over the past sixty years.
AI is the ability of a computer program to learn, think and  perform tasks that typically require human intelligence.
The advantages of AI applications are enormous and can revolutionize any  sector ( healthcare, finance, agriculture, transportation, travel, advertising, manufacturing, etc.) to create a better world.
Every new invention or breakthrough also have disadvantages, but we as humans should be aware of the potential risks  to make the most optimal use of this innovative technology. 
Human intelligence will always prevail, and we as smart people should learn how to share in a near future our lives with intelligent robots  to build up a better future for the younger generation.

sessions.title: "Imaginative Art" for a living
sessions.description:
La façon dont l'Art de la créativité peut apporter une nouvelle contribution et une nouvelle vision dans le monde du travail.
Et peut aussi donner vie à l'imagination des personnes qui sont autrement capables.

Reference: 
MidJourney AI 
Aiva (Music Creation)

sessions.title: Purple People at the heart of tech companies
sessions.description:
Artificial Intelligence, Project Management, ERPs, Business Intelligence, and massive IT infrastructures are all widely discussed, but who are these people who truly understand and bridge the gap between management and engineering? Do you identify as a Red, Blue, or «Purple» person? That is the question you should be pondering.

The industry is filled with «Purple» people but we do not talk about it much. Have you ever imagined why people who excel in both management and technological aspects are the ones who rule the system? 

Purple is created by combining the primary colours red and blue. Purple has long been associated with royalty, bravery, and strength. The leaders of the Turkish Byzantine and Roman empires wore purple. Purple velvet is used to adorn the British Crown Jewels, which are traditionally associated with the ruler in Japan.

I'll demystify the concept of «Purple» people, who are at the heart of major tech companies all over the world, and explain why they are always ahead.

Agenda of the session:

1. «Jack of All Trades» goes from derogatory to compulsory In tech
2. Who are Red, Blue, and «Purple» people?
3. What makes you a «Purple» person?
4. «Purple» people throughout the history of mankind
5. Why do we need more purple people rather than «Red» & «Blue» specifically?
6. The role & future of «Purple» people in the tech industry
7. «Purple» people in the process of Digital Transformation
8. «Purple» People within your business may mean life or death
9. «Purple» people in other sectors of the industry 
10. Multidisciplinary v/s «Purple» v/s Full-Stack
11. My experience as being «Purple»
12. Engineering Manager as being «Purple»
13. Q&A

The aim of this session is to embrace the concept of «Purple» people and to comprehend the need of those who drive the IT economy forward.

sessions.title: Python Bytecode or how Python operates
sessions.description:
Python stopped since quite some time being an interpreter. So did Ruby. Python's interpreter is in reality a virtual machine. It runs on bytecodes. Python codes as complex as they get are minced down to these magical simplistic instructions.

Understanding this part of Python is the key to excellent Python development. This session explains a mock VM's working as well as how most used Python features are executed. 

It peels down the magic of the Python show!

sessions.title: Low-code et architecture micro service
sessions.description: Présenter comment le groupe iQera a mis en place le #low-code & l'architecture #micro-services pour la refonte de son système d'information. Nous allons présenter la démarche pas à pas.

sessions.title: Jetpack Compose: UI toolkit for Android and Desktop apps
sessions.description: Jetpack Compose, the new UI toolkit by Google, has been in development for more than a year and is now stable. Through several live examples, let's see how you can bring high quality UI to your Android application and how functional programming helped achieving such as thing. We will go even further and I'll introduce Jetpack Compose for Desktop application where components from your Android app can be reused to keep the same quality of design design across the platforms.

sessions.title: Authenticating open source cloud applications with LDAP
sessions.description:
It is very common for businesses with small teams to use cloud services to synchronise their work, stay in touch etc. All of these can also be achieved using open source software. However, making the different open source applications to authenticate through a single mechanism is somewhat challenging.

In this presentation, I will cover the use of LDAP to build an authentication platform that will connect email services, Nextcloud and Rocket.Chat.

I'll cover the use of OpenLDAP and 389 Directory Server to provide the LDAP service.

sessions.title: How To OpenSource
sessions.description:
A session delving into the why of projects and the joy of being a maintainer. It explains the checklist and challenges of OpenSource development and most importantly what keeps the fuel going. 

From scratch to success, from a github user!

sessions.title: National Geo and IOT Portals  and Mobile Applications
sessions.description:
The National Computer Board will present the various national portals it has set up with all OpenSource systems and present some pilot mobile Applications which were developed based on data hosted on these portals:
a. Introduction to the national Open Data, Geo and IoT Portals
b. Open Source systems
c. Application – Speed Cameras on your GPS vehicle device
d. Mobile Application - Essential Services
e. Mobile Application – Fishing Aggregate Devices

sessions.title: Ghost theme development
sessions.description:
Ghost is a blogging platform written in JavaScript. In this presentation Ish & Kushul will cover quick techniques that can be used to create beautiful blogs using Ghost. We will cover two aspects of theme development — the traditional theming using Ghost handlebars and plugging a VueJS app to the Ghost API.

The presentation will be accompanied with code demos. Attendees may bring their laptops and code alongside as we go about developing themes for Ghost.

By the end of the session we expect attendees to have gathered enough knowledge and confidence to build their own custom theme.

sessions.title: Asset tokenization on Algorand Blockchain
sessions.description:
The session will begin with a general introduction to blockchain, and further focus on a specific one, which is Algorand.
Explaining the platform, and services (blockchains, wallet, crypto).
Then a general introduction to NFT and its popularity. Followed by a deeper understanding of the need for NFT and asset tokenization and its future implications.
There will be demos along the presentation to explain the different parts being explained. At the end of which, the creation of a crypto wallet, funding the wallet, tokenizing an asset and placing it in the wallet will be covered.

sessions.title: Encryption in AWS
sessions.description: Encryption is the pillar when ensuring data security. AWS provides the ability to add a layer of security in our architectures. In this session, some features such as Key Management, Client Side Encryption, Server Side Encryption will be discussed and how to ensure a secure cloud architecture when those features are used alongside with other AWS services:  Amazon S3, AWS Lambda, SQS (message queue), DynamoDB (NoSQL DB), AWS Secrets Manager and more..

sessions.title: Making the web the application platform of the future
sessions.description:
Google started the capabilities project, "Project Fugu" as an effort to minimize the feature gap between native and web applications, and turn it into a real application platform.

The project has been a real success so far with both Microsoft, Intel and others joining the effort, important new APIs shipping and awesome Progressive Web Apps coming to market.

In this presentation, we will look at some of the features that has turned the web into an application platform such as Progressive Web Apps and Project Fugu, and dive into some of these new core APIs

sessions.title: 5 Things I wish I knew about Core Web Vitals
sessions.description:
Last year, Google went live with changes to their Rank algorithm to include three specific performance metrics which they believe would lead to a better Internet for all. 

These three metrics are known as Core Web Vitals - Largest Contentful Paint (LCP), Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) and First Input Delay (FID). 

By now, most of us know the basics of what these metrics are. But after taking a deep dive into the nuances of how Google measures & reports on these values, we’ve come up with 5 things that most people miss when going down this road. 

We’ve helped over 20 teams understand this topic further, and we’re here to give you the cheat sheet on our recommended strategy for understanding this topic.

sessions.title: Take what’s given, use it however you need. Get to know Umbraco CMS.
sessions.description:
A Content Management System (CMS) can be treated as a very efficient toolset and a base for development of modern web applications. There are many mature, feature-rich, widely supported commercial but also open-source solutions on the market. Umbraco CMS is one of them. It’s the leading open-source ASP.NET Core CMS and we’re going to take a closer look at it.

The first part of the lecture will be held in a technology-agnostic manner, introducing the concept of CMS, their common features, the idea behind them and methodology of working with them. Then, you’ll get to know Umbraco CMS as a .NET enterprise-ready example. This will be an excellent introduction to speak about case studies from Objectivity project’s portfolio. Finally, we’ll spend some time on more practical aspects for devs, a short demo, code snippets and advice on how to get started with your own solution.

sessions.title: Cosplay
sessions.description: Use of different technique to achieve a Cosplay. Depending on the required effect different materials can be use.

sessions.title: Lightning Talks 2022
sessions.description:
After the very nice feedback of 2019 year's lightning talks and the tragedy that was 2020 & 2021, i'm bringing it back!

Each session will last 5 minutes max and they will be in quick successions with an Intro for each speaker.

Come and learn some new things ! Maybe you'll like some and get curious enough to try it yourself! 

Lightning Talk lineup

Ish Sookun - Why mirrors matter?
Girish Mahabir - Containers
Jestha B - Web Bundles
Michael Jules - Directus
Priyeshan Sreeneebus - How to juice up your game
Chittesh Sham - Sound Design
Sandeep Ramgolam - Codeflow

sessions.title: Re - Engineering the Digitalization Process
sessions.description:
The journey of digitalization is not a  walk in Disneyland, but organization that  struggles the most are the one who just hop on fancy technology and make use of fancy use cases, without investigating on their existing processes rather than analyzing and re-engineering their existing processes to find the best suited technology. 

Then what is the solution ? Well we are missing a crucial step which is the “re-engineering” exercise. Management theory suggests that any revamping of a company’s business processes with or without technology should be looked at as a “re-engineering” exercise.

Business process re-engineering allows organizations to point out exactly which fragment of their processes requires to be modernized. This allows stakeholders to identify where technology should be applied to increase the efficiency.

Overall, we need to understand that using technology to digitize our business sounds fancy, but the key to success lies in finding out what ails the business and using technology to remedy those issues before finding novel use cases of any new-age technology.

This session will emphasize on the Digitalization Process by considering Re-Engineering Exercise.

sessions.title: NFT - The future of finance
sessions.description:
NFTs are expected to disrupt the financial sector - this session will give an introduction about NFTs and how to implement them in a real use case.

Some technical elements will also be discussed including the implementation details of NFTs in terms of smart contracts and the different types of NFTs.

sessions.title: The Story Behind Freelancing
sessions.description:
The age old question from techies and non-techies alike: How do I start my coding journey, and how can I make money from it?

Description:
In trying times of the ongoing pandemic, a lot of fresh graduates are stuck at home looking for a way to earn money, start a business or just be productive overall. On the other hand, others are questioning their well-established careers, looking for a geeky change.

This session aims to share experiences (my own and those from like-minded acquaintances) on freelancing as a career, and derive the lessons and the formula behind going for freelancing in development.

Audience:
Session is targeted for young graduates and anyone choosing (or reconsidering) freelancing or launching a business as their career path. Expect a TED-talk style session, based on real life experiences.

Product of Session:
+ The Rules of Freelancing

Agenda:
+ Should you start a freelancing career or a business
+ The hidden obstacles behind freelance work
+ Starting your coding journey
+ The 3-steps to mastering a technology
+ Get 20 years of experiences at 10 years old
+ How to grow from there
+ Clients, Projects, Networks and Business
